author: bridge-bot
content:
<CarlBeek> As a means of speeding up contributions, what if the participant contributes optimistically?

1. Participant assumes the transcript they receive from the coordinator is honest (doesn't' have any low-order elements mixed into any of the points)
2. Participant mixes in their randomness & uploads updated transcript to coordinator
3. Participant software only now does subgroup checks
4. Participant attests to their contribution on twitter etc iff checks pass

author: potuz
content: what's the fallback if checks don't pass?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<CarlBeek> a) unless the coordinator is malicious, the checks will pass
b) if they don't then you just don't claim a particular contribution as your own, it is as if it didn't happen (which is what you would do anyway, just that you added in some randomness)

author: potuz
content: For b) the difference will be that the contribution will not be there vs something is seen by the whole world unless they go looking for the twitter claims
